page.title: 11CHURCH HANBOROUGH
page.content: Church Hanborough is now a very small village with few facilities. There is the church of St.Peter with a rough surfaced area to the east which is a car park for the church and for the pub opposite. In the churchyard there are sheep grazing amongst the tombstones. The pub on the opposite side of the road is called the Hand and Shears which recalls the importance of sheep farming in the district. Nearby is a post box, and a public telephone by the bus stop. The bus service goes to Witney, Woodstock and Oxford, but we looked at the timetable and the best description of the service would be "infrequent". We sat on a bench which had been placed there in 1977 to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth II.
